article.title: Dark-ages reionization and galaxy formation simulation - IX. Economics of reionizing galaxies

choices: The star formation rate in a typical galaxy at z=5.
The gas density distribution in a forming galaxy at z=5.
The distribution of dark matter in a galaxy cluster at z=5.
The temperature distribution of gas in a merging galaxy at z=5.

multiple_choice_question.text: What conclusion can be drawn from the left column of Figure 2?
choices: The molecular gas consumption time-scale increases with increasing redshift.
The molecular gas consumption time-scale is strongly dependent on the feedback model.
The molecular gas consumption time-scale is approximately constant at 300 Myr, independent of feedback.
The molecular gas fraction is directly proportional to the specific star formation rate.
The relationship between total gas fraction and specific star formation rate.
The balance between gas inflows, outflows, star formation, and gas reservoir changes.
The relationship between molecular gas fraction and specific star formation rate, incorporating the gas consumption time-scale.
The evolution of the molecular gas consumption time-scale as a function of halo mass.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the right column of Figure 3 show?
choices: The molecular gas consumption time-scale as a function of stellar mass.
The total gas consumption time-scale as a function of stellar mass.
The molecular gas consumption time-scale as a function of halo mass.
The total gas consumption time-scale as a function of halo mass.
